title: Montenidoli 2014 Fiore  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: Enticing scents of Spanish broom, citrus blossom, aromatic herb, baked bread and mature orchard fruit emerge on this elegantly structured white. The rounded savory palate shows a nice depth of flavors, including ripe yellow apple, peach, toasted almond and lemon drop. A flinty mineral vein wraps around the lingering finish while bright acidity provides balance.

title: Niner 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling, which is bolstered by 9% Malbec, 3% Merlot and 2% Carmenère, shows rounded black currant, blueberry, smoked beef and graphite on the nose. Soft tannins make for an elegant presentation, with heavy black-fruit flavors of crème de cassis and dark chocolate.

title: Paternoster 2013 Rotondo  (Aglianico del Vulture)
description: Aromas of espresso, spiced plum and whiffs of oak-driven spice take center stage on this structured red. The firm elegant palate doles out black cherry, raspberry jam, cinnamon and licorice set against assertive fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Robert Ramsay 2014 Red Heaven Counoise (Red Mountain)
description: Examples of this variety are rare in the state and this is one of the finest to date. High-toned aromas of smoke, raspberry and herb lead to piercingly pure cranberry and raspberry flavors. It shows texture, elegance and purity, with some warmth being the only thing that holds it back from going higher.

title: Terlato 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light in color and stemmy and spicy in equal parts, this light, bright wine is complex and intriguing in its offering of white pepper, baker's yeast and cranberry coated in vanilla. It delivers flavor and nuance in a pleasing showcase of the variety.

title: Testarossa 2015 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Hearty and thick aromas of raspberry, mulberry and sugar plums meet with a touch of bay leaf on the nose of this bottling from a famous vineyard. Woody and dark red fruits show on the sip, with juniper and sour cherry flavors most prominent.

title: Tolosa 2015 Heritage Edna Ranch Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Baked blackberries, nutmeg and star anise aromas make for a dense and full but not overly powerful or rich nose on this bottling. It's fairly thick and soft in body, but with some textural grip, showing flavors of black plum skins, graphite and sandalwood, before finishing on a eucalyptus kick.

title: San Simeon 2013 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dark chocolate and black cherry converge for an elegant and dense nose in this wine from the Riboli family. The palate offers an intriguing range of flavors, from blackberry to cocoa dust and black pepper. The chalky tannins still need some time to open up, but will ensure a long life.

title: Script 2013 Stage Right Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Two Blondes Cabernet Franc (50%), Benches Merlot (34%) and Dionysus Cabernet Sauvignon. Appealing scents of green herb, dark cherry and barrel spice are followed by plentiful cranberry and cherry flavors. It shows an exquisite sense of balance along with a lengthy finish.

title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Lagoalva Barrel Selection Syrah-Touriga Nacional Red (Tejo)
description: This barrel selection shows its wood-aged flavors strongly in a spicy toasty character. It does need time to bring out the ripe red fruits that are rich as well as crisp. Drink this serious wine with its firm tannins still intact from 2018.

title: Quinta do Sagrado 2009 Sagrado Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: Old vines in the quinta have produced a fine wine from a great Douro year. The tannins, although softened, are still there giving licorice flavors while supporting powerful black fruits. The only downside to this otherwise important wine is the touch of pepper that comes from the alcohol. Drink from 2018.

title: Pflüger 2015 Dürkheimer Trocken Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Smoky mineral tones and a racy, acidic edge lend structure to this dry, full-bodied Riesling. Crisp green apple and lemon flavors are mouthwatering and juicy, leading to a pleasantly bitter lime pith finish. Enjoy now through 2025.

title: Phelps Creek 2014 Cuvée Alexandrine Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: Elegance and finesse are the touchstones here, with the scaffolding to age for decades. Tight and precise, it shows pomegranate and red-berry fruit, stiff and potent tannins, and plenty of supporting acidity. Drink 2020 to 2030 and beyond.

title: Freemark Abbey 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: A pretty ribbon of gardenia opens the nose of this rich, concentrated wine, creamy in texture with a viscosity of vanilla and oak. The richness continues in deep caramel notes, as baked pear provides fruit and nuance.

title: Ermisch 2014 Erendira's Rise Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Warm and fruity from the moment you pull the cork, this ripe round satisfying wine matches raspberry and cherry fruit to vivid streaks of orange and grapefruit. Then it glides across the palate and on into a smooth rich finish, cloaked in milk chocolate. It's a lovely drink-now bottle.

title: Hentley Farm 2015 Rosé (Barossa Valley)
description: The best rosé I've tasted from Australia in recent memory, this is a blend of 80% Grenache and 20% Syrah. It's an unfashionable dark pink in color, but still shows enough acidity to balance out the ripe flavors of raspberries and cherries. It's on the fuller, richer side of things for rosé, so match it with beef or lamb off the grill this summer.

title: Insurrection 2015 Red (South Eastern Australia)
description: This is full-bodied, velvety-textured and expansive in the mouth, delivering plenty of bold cassis, chocolate and sage flavors. Some brighter, red-fruit notes mingle with mocha shadings on the surprisingly long finish.

title: Grgich Hills 2012 Miljenko's Selection Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Calistoga)
description: This 100% varietal wine opens in a whirl of compost and earthy truffle, finding a perfume of fresh-roast coffee, as firm, structured tannins give it definition. Blueberry cobbler and more of that coffee combine on the palate in a dense and powerful experience of ripe flavor. Enjoy best 2022 through 2032.

title: Foxen 7200 2014 Range 30 West Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: There is deep blackberry but also a savory beef element on the nose of this blend of 61% Cabernet Franc and 39% Merlot, as well as graphite and dried herb touches. The acidity on the sip is nearly searing, and the tannic tension is formidable, ensuring decent age-worthiness. Dary berries are the primary flavors.

title: Lapostolle 2013 Cuvée Alexandre Apalta Vineyard Made With Organic Grapes Merlot (Colchagua Valley)
description: Fully oaked plum and berry aromas are dense and inviting. This feels flush and full, with scratchy tannins. The flavor profile offers plenty of oak and related chocolate to go with blackberry and plum notes. Oak remains in the lead on the finish, which is stacked with blackberry, dark plum and wild-berry flavors. Drink through 2025.
designation: Cuvée Alexandre Apalta Vineyard Made With Organic Grapes

title: Le Vigne 2014 Di Domenico Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: There is lots of garrigue and purple flower elements to the nose of this bottling, with hints of vanilla and cola against the dark red fruit base. The thyme, sage and marjoram touches come through on the sip as well, decorating the sweeter red cherry fruit.

title: Joseph Jewell 2013 Floodgate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Sourced from a hillside block of the vineyard, Floodgate is about juicy, velvety texture with a side of grip, offering a fully decadent mouthfeel and sense of luxury. Floral on the nose, its flavors are nuanced, a touch of strawberry and cherry dotted in cola spice.

title: Joseph Jewell 2013 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From a 1,000-foot-elevation site, this wine traffics in juicy red cherry, plum and blackberry, its body robust and full-bodied. Red licorice adds to the power and brightness of acidity, the wine finding its balance between concentration and peppery spice.

title: Joseph Phelps 2014 Freestone Vineyards Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light and vibrantly high in integrated acidity, this wine is complex and savory, but white pepper is a constant. Along the nuanced layers are an earthy patch of wild strawberry and cardamom that persists elegantly on the palate.

title: Judge Palmer 2013 Ellis Alden Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Thick in berry and vanilla, this is an earthy vineyard-specific wine, robust in tannin and oaky shadows. Richly decadent, it has acidity that keeps it in check and makes it delicious now, though it could stand some cellaring. Enjoy best 2023 through 2030.

title: Baron-Fuenté NV Esprit Brut  (Champagne)
description: As with other Champagnes in the producer's range, this blends three vintages, giving it extra richness and depth of fruit flavor. Its toasty edge suggests it has also been aged in bottle. Attractive and ripe, it's ready to drink.

title: Vigne Surrau 2013 Sincaru Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)
description: Made entirely with Cannonau, this boasts enticing aromas of red berries, dried rose petals and Mediterranean underbrush. The savory robust palate delivers black cherries, raspberries, white pepper and almond alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Captûre 2015 Tradition Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Pea shoots and a faraway lawn provide a fresh inspiring of springtime in this stainless-steel fermented white that's lovely and fully expressive on the palate. Jasmine notes are joined by tastes of apricot and peach, while tropical breezes blow by.

title: Carbone 2012 400 Some  (Aglianico del Vulture)
description: Smooth and structured, this offers aromas and flavors of fleshy wild cherry, mature plum, new leather, grilled herb, clove, licorice and balsamic notes. Smooth velvety tannins carry the rich flavors and lend finesse. It's already accessible and even though it doesn't have a lot of complexity, it's juicy and delicious. Drink through 2020.

title: Castelnau 2003 Millésimé Brut  (Champagne)
description: It's interesting to taste a wine from the unusually hot 2003 vintage after almost 14 years. It has held up well, yet shows definite signs of maturity. The toasty character typical of older Champagnes contrasts with the crisp apple fruitiness. Drink now.
